CoST IDS draft definition: Name of the sponsoring Government department
Mapping to OC for Infrastructure: Project Level: Add an entry to ``parties`` with 'owner' included in its ``.roles``
Mapping from OCDS: OCDS: Check for parties with 'buyer' or 'publicAuthority' in ``.roles`` and infer from ``.name``

CoST IDS draft definition: Develop a list of sectors relevant to country e.g. housing, transport, energy, water etc.
Mapping to OC for Infrastructure: Project Level: Publish as ``sector``, with any additional sectors in ``additionalClassifications``
Mapping from OCDS: OCDS: Map from ``planning.project.sector`` (Budget and projects extension, PPP profile)

CoST IDS draft definition: Develop a subset for each sector e.g. Transport could be subdivided into national highway, local road, railway, port, airport etc.
Mapping from OCDS: OCDS: Copy from ``planning.project.additionalClassifications`` (Budget and projects extension, PPP profile)
OCDS: Copy from ``planning.project.title`` (Budget and projects extension, PPP profile); if not available, infer from ``tender.title``

CoST IDS draft definition: Briefly specify location of the project
Mapping to OC for Infrastructure: Project Level: Publish using the ``locations`` fields as an address, geometry (point/line/polygon) or gazetteer entry
Mapping from OCDS: OCDS: Copy from ``planning.project.locations`` (Budget and projects extension, PPP profile); if not available, infer from ``tender.items.deliveryLocation`` or ``tender.items.deliveryAddress`` (Location extension)

CoST IDS draft definition: Specify the socio economic purpose of the project
Mapping from OCDS: OCDS: Infer from ``planning.rationale`` and check ``planning.documents`` for documents with ``.type`` set to 'needsAssessment'

CoST IDS draft definition: Concise description and details of the project
Mapping from OCDS: OCDS: Copy from ``planning.project.description`` (Budgets and projects extension, PPP proflie); if not available, infer from ``tender.description``
